instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> fan spin and stop
threads.message:
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> this is issue ,attached video, where can i check

[MEDIA=youtube]e2l10kvhPNc[/MEDIA]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> fan spin and stop
threads.message:
Do you get CPU core voltage in that time?
What about <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?
Did you try starting in SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> fan spin and stop
threads.message:
cpu core 1.8v
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  2.8v
 yes when fan spinning 

cpu getting usual heat . fan not on with power button. tested with charging battery

threads.message:

Did you try SMC bypass?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> fan spin and stop

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> fan spin and stop
threads.message:
If board starts in normal mode, should also start in SMC bypass.
Did correctly SMC bypass?
Read this:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> fan spin and stop
threads.message: board not on normally with power button, i show you video ,it happening only with charger

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> fan spin and stop
threads.message: Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>, at same time.
